intro: Erysimum patens, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often tinged with purple. Erysimum patens thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
